articles.title: Marie-Caroline Compans
articles.contents:
MC Compans
          Research
          
          
          ☰
          
          
      
        
          
            
              
            
              Marie-Caroline Compans
            
            
              
                
                    
                      
                        Email
                      
                    
                  
                                    
                    
                      
                        LinkedIn

                        Twitter
                      
                    
                  
                                  
            
          
        
        
        
          
            
            Welcome!
            I’m a postdoctoral researcher at the French National
            Institute for Demographic Studies (Ined) within the SOCMISC project. I
            work on miscarriages, assisted reproduction, infertility and
            (late) fertility. I am also associated with the Department
            of Demography of the University of Vienna, where I
            participated in the BIC.Late
            project.
            
            
            Research experience
            Postdoctoral researcher, French National
            Institute for Demographic Studies (Ined) | July. 2024 -
            present
            Postdoctoral researcher, University of
            Vienna - Wittgenstein Centre | June 2021 - Sept. 2024
            Ph.D. Candidate, French National
            Institute for Demographic Studies (Ined) | Sept. 2017 - June
            2021
            
            
            Education
            Ph.D. in Demography, University Paris I
            Panthéon-Sorbonne / Ined | Sept. 2017 - June 2021
            Master in Quantitative Sociology and
            Demography (M1&M2), University Paris-Saclay |
            Sept. 2015 - June 2017
            Detailed CV here

articles.title: Research
articles.description: Research topics: fertility, birth postponement, family change, assisted reproduction, miscarriages
articles.contents:
Work in progress
Compans MC. and Väisänen, H., Social patterns of miscarriage reporting and risk: Insights from survey data in France preprint
Compans, MC., Beaujouan, E., Trimarchi, A., The role of the partner age gap on first births by age at union
formation (cross-regional perspective)
Setz, I., Compans, MC., Beaujouan, E., 2023, Spatial and temporal variation of late fertility across European regions. short abstract
Compans, MC., Lazzari, E. and Beaujouan, E., 2023, Perceptions of Medically Assisted Reproduction and Women’s Fertility Choices
Suero, C., Compans, MC., Beaujouan, E., 2023, Delayed transitions to adulthood and the use of assisted reproduction by
education in Spain
Peer-reviewed publications
Compans, MC., 2024, “Alignment, anticipation, adaptation or lagging behind? Age-based regulations in assisted reproduction and late fertility”, Population and Development Review, doi: https://doi.org/10.1111/padr.12658
Compans, MC. and Zagel H., 2024, “Medically assisted reproduction and non-normative family forms: legislation and public opinion in Europe”.
European Societies (accepted). link to the preprint
Lazzari, E., Compans, MC. and Beaujouan, E., 2024, “Change in
the perceived reproductive age window and delayed fertility in
Europe”, Population Studies. doi: 0.1080/00324728.2023.2298678.
link
Compans, MC., Beaujouan, E. and Suero C., 2023, “Transitions to
second birth and birth intervals in France and Spain: time squeeze
or social norms?”, Comparative Population Studies, vol.48,
pp.307-338. doi: 10.12765/CPoS-202.
link
Compans, MC. and Beaujouan, E., 2022, “From Union Formation to
First Birth: The Role of Age at First Cohabitation in the Transition
to Motherhood and Fatherhood”, Population, vol.77 (3), pp.411-436.
doi :10.3917/popu.2203.0439.
link
Compans, MC., 2021, “D’un ‘problème de santé publique’ à un
‘phénomène de société’. Le traitement médiatique des maternités et
des paternités tardives en France (2001–2019)”, Enfances,
Familles, Générations, doi: 10.7202/1090938ar.
link
Compans, MC., 2021, “Late motherhood, late fatherhood and
permanent childlessness in France: Trends by educational level and
cohorts (1950-1970)”, Demographic Research, vol.45 (10),
pp.329-344. doi: 10.4054/DemRes.2021.45.10.
link
Other publications
Compans, MC. and Beaujouan, E., 2023, “Where do couples meet?”,
in Families in Austria Partnerships, fertility intentions and
economic situation in challenging times, Neuwirth, N.,
Buber-Ennser, I., Fux, B. (eds.), p.10.
link
Lazzari, E. and Compans, MC., 2023, “Assisted reproduction:
prevalence among men and women”, in Families in Austria
Partnerships, fertility intentions and economic situation in
challenging times, Neuwirth, N., Buber-Ennser, I., Fux, B., Fux
(eds.),
p.39. link
Beaujouan, E., Compans, MC. and Gutmorgeth L., 2023, “Finding a
viable path to”ageing” fertility in Europe”, Policy Insights,
Population Europe.
link
Compans, MC., 2021, “Late mothers and late fathers have a first
birth with younger partners”, N-IUSSP.
link
Chatot, M., Compans, MC., Quennehen M., Yadan, Z., 2021,
“Introduction. Dossier : Instituer la famille. Entre parenté et
parentalité”, Revue des politiques sociales et familiales,
vol.139-140, pp.3-8. doi: 10.3917/rpsf.139.0003.
link
Compans, MC., 2021, “Is it too late to catch up? Comparing
female and male fertility changes”, PopDigests (Population
Europe).
link
Compans, MC., 2021, “Le déclin de la fertilité : une charge
inégalement partagée entre hommes et femmes”, The Conversation.
link
PhD Thesis
Pour qui sonne l’heure ? Devenir père ou mère tardivement à l’épreuve
des normes et de l’âge [For Whom the Clock Tolls? Becoming a late
father or a late mother facing norms and age].
link
Supervisors : Elise de La Rochebrochard (Ined, Inserm) and Arnaud
Régnier-Loilier (Ined)
